mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Potamolepidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect water currents and particle movement for filter feeding. Inferred based on general sponge biology.

chemoreception.notes: Likely utilize chemoreception to detect dissolved organic matter and other chemical cues in the water for feeding and coordinating cellular activities. Inferred based on general sponge biology.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreception is currently unknown. Sponges generally lack specialized photoreceptor cells, although some studies suggest light sensitivity in certain species.
